column1: starts off with a very full ball outside off, Dickwella jams the bat down
fuller on leg and middle, kept out
short of a length ball, angled across from leg and middle and it is tucked off the hips into the leg side for the first runs of the morning

extra bounce. Banged in on leg stump and he does not keep his eyes on the ball as he tries to keep it out to the leg side. Gets it on the glove and the ball balloons towards point before dropping short
beaten outside off. Opened up with a tempter that is angling away and he walks into the forward push

nearly had him. fuller and on the pads, turned away uppishly to leg slip and the ball does not carry. Miller makes a diving stop and fires a direct throw at the striker's end. Direct hit could have seen the back of him

plumb, that looked out from the moment  it his him on the pad. Dickwella moves across the stumps and tries to work it to the leg side as he plays for the swing. But the ball comes on dead straight and the umpire needs little time to raise his finger
full and on the fourth-stump channel, pushed across from over the wicket and Mendis presses forward and drives. Goes a little hard at it and ends up not being in control of it entirely
walks across to protect the off-stump and lets it go
full and angling away outside off and it is left alone in the channel
persists with the fuller ball in the channel outside off and the batsman does not bother going after it
straightening late. Length ball that seems to be angling away but comes on straight after pitching. The angle is still wide enough and Mendis is sure of his off-stump as he leaves it
sprayed on the pads. Fullish and it is just picked up off of the toes and flicked over square leg
full, wide, angled across, walks into the shot and gets opened up as he skews i off the outer part of the blade through the backward point region
full and on the pads, supple wrists and beautiful control as he flicks it away off the pads to the right of mid-on who makes a half-attempt at a dive but it is well wide of him anyway

tails back in sharply from the length region and shoots from over the off-stump to the wicketkeeper as the batsman shoulders arms. Good judgement from Mendis. That one came off the seam but also had considerable bounce
left alone in the channel outside off

edged and snaffled at first slip. Straightforward catch for Hashim Amla and Parnell has struck once each in his first two overs. It was slightly wide outside off but there is not enough room to free the arms. Seems like it moves away slightly late as well and there is a healthy edge
good length ball on the stumps, uses the angle and turns it away into the on side
comes forward and reaches a long way across to drive this fuller ball square of the wicket and third man runs across and slides to cut it off before the boundary
good length, angling in on off from around the wicket, defended with a straight bat and with bat close to pad
short of a length outside off, shuffles across to cover the off stump before lifting his bat and letting it go
fullish and on the stumps, blocked towards mid-off
short ball, gets up well outside off and the batsman lets it go
fuller ball, comes forward and pushes it to mid-on
full and holding its line outside off, comes forward and drives it but cannot find the gap in the off side
good length and angling in on leg stump at 134 clicks, defended quietly with a straight bat
fullish and angling in on off, comes forward and blocks into the off side
angling in at pace on off, 141 clicks, blocked into the off side off the front foot
good length and angling in around the same region, comes forward and cautiously pushes it off the front foot
turned away to square leg. No run there
length ball, but of movement away from leg and middle and Chandimal's bat face turns in his hands as he defends it and the ball goes to the off side
jumps up to ride the bounce and drops this short of a length ball into the off side
short ball, good pace, 143 kph, Mendis arches back to sway out of the line and lets it go
short of good length ball outside off, rides the bounce and drops it towards point with soft hands. Man there, so no run possible
fullish ball, comes on exactly at 140 clicks and it is driven off the front foot where extra cover dives to make a stop
nice shot. Beautiful control and god timing. It's full and comes on leg stump. Pushes it gently off the front foot and the ball beats mid-on as he gets a straight boundary
short ball, gets on top of it before dropping it in front of point
good length ball in the corridor of uncertainty. Makes a late call to leave it and lifts the bat away as the ball shoots through to the wicketkeeper. Could have unknowingly nicked to the keeper
good length, tight line on off, bunted gently to mid-off on the front foot
very full and outside off, Chandimal angles his bat and squeezes the ball down to third man
full and angled in on off, defended to the off side
beats the outside edge! Full, angled in on off stump, Mendis was playing for the angle. But this one straightens away late, passing the outside edge
pretty full on middle and leg, Mendis picks it up and smartly chips it over mid-on. Deliberately done
half-volley outside off, Mendis does not need second invitations. He bends forward and crunches a drive, the ball whistles away past the left of short extra cover
full and holds its line outside off, left alone
good length and outside off, gets forward and pushes it to point
full and angled in on off, Chandimal is on the move as he drives to mid-on
very full and outside off, encourages Chandimal to drive. He presses forward and pushes it straight to mid-off
low full-toss, angled in on off stump, squeezed to midwicket on the front foot, more off the inside half than the middle
another low full-toss, this is on off and middle, driven back to the bowler. Morris makes a tumbling save in his follow-through. Morris marks his return with a maiden
starts off with a full ball around off stump, defended to cover, coming forwards
full and floats through outside off as Chandimal lets it pass
length and outside off, opens the face and glides to point on the front foot
look at the poise from Mendis. Full and outside off - not a half-volley - Mendis eases forward and middles a drive through cover-point
the bowler drags his length back outside off, Mendis skips back and punches the ball towards point
Mendis lashes a cut, beats backward point to his left and deep third man to his right. Impressive placement. Short of a length and width outside off, crashed away in the gap off the back foot.
tucked off the hips behind square and the fielder in the deep runs across and cuts it off in front of the deep fine leg fence as he runs across and flings himself full length to his right
good length ball outside off, comes forward and blocks into covers
fuller on the stumps, drops it with soft hands in front of mid-off and calls for a very quick single and they beat de Villiers who does not gather it cleanlly
short ball outside off, leans back and drops his wrists to let it go
short of a length, well wide outside off, tailing in late but there is enough width for a comfortable leave
back of a length ball, tucked away to midwicket and calls for a very quick single, calls for the run but is sent back as the fielder runs in and picks it up quickly
worked away behind square
fuller ball outside off, comes forward and pushes it into covers
good length ball, angling in, tucked to midwicket and they again call for the quick single. This time they take it as Miller has to run to his right and slide in to pick it up
short ball, pulled away behind square with soft hands, does not hit it hard
short and wide, slapped hard off the backfoot and gets it past the diving point fielder. Duminy tries to get down to this left with his hand outstretched but the ball goes from beneath his fingers
short of a length and outside off, waits on the backfoot and opens the face of his bat and runs it down to third man
short of a length and cut off the backfoot square of the wicket before the ball is picked up in the deep
good length ball, defended to the left of the bowler
fullish and outside off, Mendis comes forward and dabs it towards mid-off and they again take on AB de Villiers for a quick single and manage to complete it t bring up the team's fifty
short of a length and angling in, tries to tuck off the hips and makes no contact
short ball, rises considerably as the batsman ducks and it is another wide
short of  a length and some width outside off, punched off the backfoot to point and closes out the over with a dot ball
short ball, banged in at 133.3 kph, ducked under comfortably
short of good length, angling in on the stumps, tucked off the pads behind square
fuller ball on off-stump, comes forward and pushes it to mid-off who slides across to field it

walks across the stumps and tries to flick it away but is beaten by the angle and wears it on the pad as the ball goes towards fine leg. They steal a leg bye and a throw is fired at the keeper's end which misses. Coming back to the lbw chance, it was heading down leg. There is, in fact, hardly any appeal from the players
short ball, gets under it
fuller on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler from the crease
full on off, pushed off the front foot to mid-off
short of a length ball on the stumps, stays back and stands tall before defending off the backfoot to the left of the bowler
back of a length on off, the backhand comes off the handle as he stabs it into the off side from the crease
good length, angling in, tucked to midwicket where there is a fielder and Mendis makes a loud call for no
short ball on off, barely rises chest-high, Mendis rises on his tippy toes and blunts the ball in front of cover
full and veering into the pads now, Mendis uses his wrists and clips the ball along the ground to deep midwicket
bouncer outside off - tennis-ball bounce - the batsman drops his wrists on it
Mendis waddles across the off stump, meets a back-of-a-length ball on off and drops it defensively to the leg side
tight line on off stump, Mendis presses forward and pushes the ball to mid-off with soft hands
back of a length and on off stump, Mendis jumps back and plays a jabbing punch to short cover
short ball outside off, sticks in the surface, and messes with Mendis' timing. Short-armed away to midwicket
bouncer, jumps off the surface, Mendis ducks. Too high and called a wide
full and angling into the pads, chipped in the gap at midwicket
short of a length and angling in at around 134 clicks, tucked off the pads behind square and they jog the single
length ball outside off, gets a long way across and defends straight back to the bowler with bat close to pad
short of a length ball outside off, waits in the crease and opens the face of his bat before guiding it to gully
walks across and forward to take it on the full before flicking it away to midwicket
good length ball, turns it away behind square
short of a length ball, uses the inward angle and tucks it off the pads to deep backward square leg
short of good length, waits for it at the crease before tucking it to midwicket
fuller and on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot to point
short ball, swivels around with the pull and the ball goes to deep fine leg

short ball, width on offer outside off and he tries to rock back and slap it uppishly but the ball stops on him as it comes on after landing and he ges beaten as he is through with the shot a bit quickly
comes forward and defends to the covers region

fuller ball, driven past the bowler who gets down to his left. Mid-off fumbles as he tries to pick it up and then mid-on runs back and fields it. It was driven on the up past the bowler, dropped just in front of him
swing and a miss outside off. Width on offer outside off but it tails back in very late and he cannot make contact as he looks to go big over the off side
fuller ball outside off and it is pushed to de Villiers at mid-off. They take him on again, and again he fumbles as he cannot pick it up cleanly. De Villiers having a rare off day in the field
short of a length and in the corridor of uncertainty. Superb leave from the batsman as he judges the bounce and trusts the angle to let it go as the ball goes from over off to the wicketkepeer
good length ball on the stumps, comes forward and blocks with a straight bat to the left of the bowler and the ball goes towards mid-off
fuller and outside off, driven on the up to Miller at cover and he gets down and wraps his hands around the ball. The crowd is momentarily excited but that did not go on the full to Miller
comes on flat and at good pace, 90kph, on leg stump and it is defended
fullish and on the pads, defended towards where short leg would have been
does not pick the googly and drills it hard and on the up to midwicket but luckily for him it does not carry to midwicket
this one is again worked away to midwicket and Miller does not gather it cleanly, parries it away a bit and they take the single
floated up and bowls a low full toss that is swept out to the region between deep midwicket and deep square leg
pitched right up on off stump and it is squeezed out back to the bowler
good length outside off, comes forward and crunches a drive through extra cover. That's Chandimal's first boundary off the 47th ball and the first boundary overall since the 12th over
nudhes it to the on side and shows some urgency in stealing a quick single by the time the fielder at midwicket can run in and pick up the ball
glorious drive through mid-off. Half-volley outside off and he strides forward before laying into a firm drive straight through the mid-off region
short of good length outside off, backs away to ride the bounce before defending to point
short of good length and down the leg side, fails to make contact as he attempts to glance it
back of a length just outside off, waits in the crease and watchfully drops it in front of point with soft hands
short ball, angling in, swivels around and pulls and the ball lands in front of the fielder running in from deep fine leg, goes one-bounce straight to him
tossed up outside off, seems like it was the googly, spinning in from the length region and it is dabbed into the on side
flat but not all that short, Chandimal gets down on one knee and slog-sweeps it to deep midwicket
comes forward to push and gets it off the inside part of the bat to long-on
clipped off the toes to midwicket

gets down to sweep and gets rapped on the pads. Umpire Richard Kettleborough raises his finger. but Chandimal has reviewed this. That was an ill-advised attempt at a sweep as it comes on straight and too full and he cannot make contact. In fact, he has made contact, has got a top edge before the ball bangs into the pad
slides in with the arm on leg and it is tucked to the leg side
back of a length and angled in on leg stump, neatly glanced away to long leg as Mendis brings up a half-century
length and outside off, angled down to third man for one
chest-high short ball outside off, Mendis pivots on the back foot, rides the bounce, and pulls it to deep square leg
much fuller and outside off, Chandimal opens the face and dabs a single fine of third man
115.4ks slower-ball bouncer drifts down leg, Rabada rolls his fingers across this. Chandimal shuffles across off, pulls early, think the ball grazed the glove, but it dropped in front of the keeper
picked away to deep square leg for one
looped up on middle and leg, defended
pretty full on off, gets forward and push-drives a single to long-on
full, straight ball on middle, which is played back to Tahir
tossed-up legbreak outside off, the batsman is not close enough to the pitch as he chips a drive to cover
wrong'un from Tahir, spins in, Chandimal does not pick it at all. Struck on the pad

another wrong'un and this bursts through the gate of Chandimal. Tahir gives it plnety of air; spins back in on off after pitching outside off. Chandimal is stapled to the crease as he wafts and gets beaten on the inside edge. The ball clips the top of off stump
placed with laser-guided precision. Beats a diving short extra cover to his right and AB to his left at mid-off. A bit overpitched and outside off, leans forward and unfurls a wristy drive
Rabada drags his length back outside off, Mendis does not bother with it
back of a length and on off, turned away through square leg
Rabada greets Tharanga with a 139.7ks bouncer. He slips under it
back of a length and holds its line outside off, steered away to point
back of a length on off, blocked on the back foot
tossed up and turns away outside, Mendis looks to defend on the front foot. The ball takes the outside edge and runs away to short third man
quicker on middle and leg, Mendis works this full ball to midwicket
slider outside off, left alone
flatter on off stump, bends forward and blocks to the right of Tahir
loopier on off stump, driven down to long-on
tossed on off stump, Tharanga gets forward and secures a single to long-off. Smooth little push from the SL captain
Rabada raps the splice of the bat. Skiddy short ball on off, Tharanga yanks his bottom hand off the bat and fends it away. The ball hit the bat as opposed to bat hitting ball
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and drops the ball in front of slip and hares across to the other end
lifter outside off, 133.5ks, hunkers down
back of a length and outside off, left alone
nearly grazed the outside edge on its way to de Kock. Good length, angled in, and cuts away past the hanging bat. Crackling delivery
Rabada shortens his length and goes wide outside off, nothing doing from the batsman
quicker and slides across off, Tharanga moves back and angles the ball out to point
tossed up full on middle, gets forward and slices a drive square through the off side for one
Duminy tears across to his right, dives to his right, and swats the ball inside the field of play. Terrific commitment. Mendis jumps down the track, and dares to go against the spin. Dragged away
pushed down the ground, Duminy in the action again. He clutches his left hamstring
fizzes outside off, 96.2ks, guided to point

Mendis has been given out lbw by umpire Kettleborough, he challenges the on-field decision. Lovely legbreak from Tahir, starts around middle, opens 'em him, grips and spins away to strike the knee-roll of the back pad, fizzing past the outside edge, in front of off stump. Pitching in line, impact in line, and hitting off stump. Three reds and Mendis has to exit for 62
full on off, played back to Duminy
length-ball offbreak, dabbed to point on the front foot
nudged off the pads to square leg
short and slides across off, chopped to point
hurrying ball outside off, now it's Tharanga's turn to chop it square on the off side
full and outside off, driven on the front foot to extra cover

Catch him if you can. Tahir sets off on a typical celebratory sprint. Tahir hangs it up outside off, Tharanga presses forward, carelessly drives the ball in the air.... Head-high catch for Duminy at cover. Tahir is slicing through the SL middle order
full-toss on off, driven down to long-on
straight roller on off, de Silva blocks with a straight bat
very full on off, jabbed down to long-on
full and sliding into the leg stump, Asela knocks it defensively to midwicket
short of a length and sliding across off, back-foot punch to sweeper cover
slung down leg, left alone, leg-side wide
good length and drifting across off, de Silva pokes away from the body and misses
slider outside off with a hint of extra bounce, de Silva attempts a risky dab down to third man. Beaten again
full on the stumps, pushed down the ground on the front foot
full and angled in on off from over the wicket, defended back to Duminy
lobbed up on off or just a shade outside off, Asela offers a dead bat
length-ball legbreak outside off, glided down to third man
full on off, defended
De Silva isn't close to to the pitch of this legbreak, chips a drive to mid-off
very full on off, dead-batted
pushed through on off, defended in the direction of silly mid-on
full and straight, clipped away past short mid-on's right, but Duminy at long-on hunts the ball down
full and slanting away outside off, ignored
back of a length and angling away, de Silva absorbs the pace and guides it with soft hands towards point
off-side wide, de Kock throws himself to his right to glove the ball
full on off, presses forward, flicks to mid-on for a single
full and outside off, swings away further, Asela shoulders arms. Harsh call from Jele. Just inside the guideline I guess

length ball, angled in, kicks away outside off, hits the shoulder of the bat as Asela rises on his toes. Beats Faf to his left at slip. Did not carry. The ball sneaks away between slip and keeper for four
short of a length and outside off, chopped fine of third man. Andile runs across to his left, slides, and keeps it to three
skiddy short ball on off, Asela skips back and pulls away to deep midwicket
tossed up higher on off stump, presses forward and defends to leg
much slower through the air, too full for the sweep. Paddles and lobs the ball square on the leg side
very full and outside off, gets forward and drives to cover
tossed-up legbreak, he eyes the leg side and ends up squirting a leading edge down to mid-off
quicker on the stumps, pushed back to Tahir who dives to his right and fumbles
very full and outside off, driven to mid-off on the front foot
length and outside off, opens the face and dinks the ball to point
inswinging yorker on off stump, de Silva topples over, and somehow jams the ball in the direction of wide mid-on
glanced to Tahir at long leg for a single
back of a length on off, de Silva chops his bat down on it. The ball bounces in front of his back toe and threatens to land on the stumps, but de Silva is aware of it. He swats it away with his bat

A mix-up between the wickets - the last thing SL needed - they sent it upstairs. Asela is caught short at the non-striker's end. Not out flashes on the big screen? What? TV umpire Illingworth quickly cleans up the mess and out flashes now. The middle-order slump shows no signs of abating. De Silva had driven the ball to the left of the off-side sweeper, Morris hunted the ball down, a bit of yes-no between Asela and de Silva. Morris capitalises on it, throws the ball to the keeper who relays it to Parnell. Gone...
tickled off the pads towards long leg
tight line on off, blocked to midwicket

tucked away off the hips to square leg, the fielder aims a throw at the non-striker's end. TV umpire called in again. Umpire Illingworth calls it right - Not out. Faf nailed the stumps down.  Kulaseka plonked his bat down rather than sliding it in. He is safe
high short ball outside off, more a short-arm flap than a short-arm pull as the ball goes only as far as mid-on
back of a length and outside off, guided to point for a hurried single
run down to third man
just short of a good length and angled in, Kulasekara hops and defends to leg
short of a length and outside off, french cut down to third man off a thick inside edge, which ran away past the leg stump
tennis-ball bounce, short on off, sticks in the surface, the batsman hangs his bat up. Fended to leg
very full and outside off, drives through the line and finds mid-off
short ball on off, pivots on the back foot and pulls to the left of long leg
slightly overpitched and outside off, de Silva punishes it. Drives on the up and laces it over a leaping extra cover. Beats mid-off to his left too
length ball outside off, Kulasekara sizes it up and launches it straight down the ground. Super clean strike
full and sliding into the pads, picked away to square leg
rank long-hop outside off, swatted away to the deep midwicket fence. Kulasekara is only the second player after Mendis to hit two or more boundaries in this innings
nice and full outside off,  Kulasekara plays inside the line and is beaten emphatically
full on middle, played back to the bowler
good length on off, Kulaseka is halfway forward as he blocks back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, dropped defensively in front of point
good length and angled in on off, played back down the pitch
short and angled in, too close to off for the cut as he is cramped up for room. Ends up chopping the ball to cover
full and just a shade outside off, dinked in front of cover. De Silva searches for a quick single, is isn't there
very full and outside off, handsomely driven on the up to extra cover
full and on leg stump, deftly glanced away towards long leg
short, fizzes in, cramps the batsman for room. Inside-edged onto the pad as the ball rolls square on the leg side
looped up on middle and leg, nurdled into the vacant spaces at midwicket
flat slider on middle, nearly 97ks, jammed out
tight line on off, defended back
leg-stump ball, eased square on the leg side
short and outside off, chopped towards point
short ball, angling down leg, just over leg stump and so it's not called a wide

edged and drops short of first slip. Cross-seam slower delivery, on a length and outside off, the batsman chases it and gets an outside edge. That one gripped the surface and came on slowly so the edge also does not carry but de Kock recovers well an ensures that it is only a single
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man
sticks his bat out without any feet and gets beaten outside off as this one holds its line around the fifth-stump channel

whay would you bowl that line with two slips in place? Short of good length but tailing in to the right-hander and all Kulasekara just has to tuck off the hips as the ball goes to the fine leg boundary

that's more like it. Fires it full and it comes on straight outside off. Tempts the batsman to go after it outside off and Kulasekara does so, that too, without feet. Sticks his bat out a long way across and gets a healthy outside edge that flies to the right of de Kock who snaffles a brilliant low catch as he he gets down to his right
fires it in on the pads and the batsman uses the inward angle to clip off the toes behind square on the leg side
forces him back with a back of a length ball on the stumps and Vandersay very awkwardly fends it off as he jumps up
fires it straight and bang on the stumps, Vandersay is hassled back as he forces a defence back to the bowler
short ball, going down the leg side as the batsman gets under it and it is called a wide

back of a length and some width on offer outside off, tries to drill it through the off side but cannot make good connection, does not get it off the middle of the bat as he works it to the point region
edged and goes to the third man boundary. Presses forward but only slightly so as he tries to crunch a drive through the off side to this fuller ball and ends up skewing it to the third man boundary
fullish and on the pads, clipped away off the toes to the midwicket region
slower bouncer, barely comes on, pulled away with soft hands through the square leg region
fuller and outside off, in the corridor of uncertainty, left alone
sees some width on offer outside off and stays back before deliberately opening the bat face to run it down to third man, gets it slightly off the splice
fuller ball, driven crisply to mid-off for a quick single
short ball, left alone outside off
tucked off the pads to midwicket
nudges it to the short fine leg region
googly, spinning in from the short of a length region, but perhaps because it is short, the batsman has enough time to pick up the variation and he just pushes it gently down to long-on
wrong'un again, this time it is fuller and Vandersay drives it out to covers off the front foot
fuller outside off, presses across and pushes it to the point region
flatter and slower, it's the slider and it is tucked off the pads through the square leg region
defended back to the bowler
length ball, turns it away to midwicket for a quick single
short ball, stops on him as it comes on to him and he cannot get hold of the pull shot as the ball goes to deep midwicket
bunted down the pitch

fuller ball, Vandersay was walking right across, playing for the angle, but it comes a tad straighter than he expects it to and he misses contact on the flick. Gets rapped on the pads, looks close and the umpire Jele raises his finger. Could the inward angle perhaps have taken it down leg? Sri Lanka do not have any reviews left. But it looks close, would have perhaps clipped leg and the umpire's call would have remained
full toss on the stumps, perhaps got the yorker wrong and it comes at a not too comfortable height for Lakmal who drills it hard but does not time it too well through the off side
short ball, gets slightly big on him and comes into him, drops it with soft hands in front of backward point

and Dhananjaya also perishes. Could this spell the end for Sri Lanka? A 200 score now seems a distant possibility. The ball is pitched right up there and Dhananjaya tries to go big down the ground. Du Plessis is inside the circle at mid-off and he runs to his right to snaffle it as the ball is skied. Looking to hit with the wind but does not get the distance
fuller ball, again does not find the middle of the bat as he drills it towards mid-off
short ball, gets the bottom edge on the pull shot as the ball goes to deep backward square leg
fuller ball, just outside off, stays on the backfoot and stabs it out to the covers region
full, angling down leg, just escapes contact with the pad as he does not make contact on the glance and the ball goes down the leg side
fuller outside off, comes forward and quietly pushes it to covers
good length ball, stays back and moves back towards leg stump before keeping it out with a straight bat

short of a length ball, backs away and drops it in front of covers and Sandakan takes off for a quick single before he is sent back. Duminy picks it up and fires a throw which misses. Direct hit and he would have been comfortably out
fuller ball, pushed back to the bowler
length ball, angling in on the pads, tucked away behind square
sprayed down the leg side again and the batsman does not make contact on the glance
fullish and outside off, comes forward and pushes it into the covers region
short of a length, pushes the batsman on to the backfoot and he tries to guide it past backward point but Duminy makes a diving save
full and fast on the leg stump, tries to glance it away but misses and is struck on the pad. But they do not even appeal as it was clearly heading down leg

short of good length, tucked off the pads to midwicket and Duminy runs in and collects it before firing a throw at the keeper's end. Lakmal has to put in the dive but a direct hit would have still seen the back of him
gets the front leg out of the way, perhaps looking to slog but the bowler follows him and he swipes hard to get it through the deep square leg region
fuller ball, pushed gently back to the bowler
fullish outside off, opens the bat face late to guide it past backward point
shor tof a length, angling in, tucked away to deep square leg off the pads and they jog the single
short of good length, angling down, tries to pull but decides against it as the ball goes down the leg side
fuller ball outside off, jams the bat down and squeezes it out to the covers region
good length ball on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
almost a full toss outside off but it dips late, very late, and in fact it' a yorker wide outside off, cannot squeeze it out as the bat jams hard into the turf
short ball, angling down leg, tries to pull and does not make contact as the angle carries i further down the leg side
wild slog ends the innings. Lakmal throws everything at it and misses it completely as the ball crashes into middle stump. It is full and tails in late. Lakmal misses and Morris hits
veering into the pads, misses the flick, they sneak in a leg-bye
short of a length and outside off, stands up tall and forces the ball to mid-off
full and angling away outside off, flicked through the square-leg region
pitched and floats through outside off, Amla leaves it be
short of a length and outside off, this is a pretty slow surface, Amla attempts a forcing cut. The ball goes only as far as cover
back of a length and angled in on off, punched past the left of a diving short midwicket, but mid-on has the ball covered
edged, but does not carry to first slip. Full and angling away outside off, De Kock throws his hands at a drive and sends a thick outside edge, dies a couple of centimetres in front of lone slip
full and outside off, driven solidly now, through the line to mid-off
short of a length and outside off, chopped to point
length ball on off, turned to square leg
full and angling away outside off, not a half-volley, driven on the up, but straight to mid-on
full and outside off, De Kock, who is standing outside the crease, whips the ball firmly. Can't beat mid-on again
full on off, Amla is solid in defence
full and outside off, Amla plays a wristy drive and finds point
Amla gets off the mark with a back-foot punch in the gap at cover. This was shortish and outside off, Amla stood tall and placed it nicely
full on off, presses forward and push-drives the ball straight to mid-off
full, starts outside off, and swings away further. Amla flashes a long way away from the body and sends an outside edge towards deep third man
length and angling away outside off, jabbed down to mid-on
whipped away to the right of midwicket and to the left of mid-on. This wasn't a genuine bad ball. Full and outside off, de Kock simply manipulated it with his wrists
good length and angled in on off, presses forward and plays a jabbing drive down to mid-off
122.5ks little cutter from Lakmal, comes in from around the wicket, beats the inside edge and dies on its way to the keeper
back of a length and angled in around off stump, clipped away through midwicket
back of a length on off, punched down the pitch to mid-on
short of a length and outside off, forced to point
back of a length and outside off, de Kock prefers to punch to mid-on rather than mid-off
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
he shimmies out and whips a single into the vacant spaces near midwicket
bouncer outside off, too high, Amla can't connect with a back-foot hook
length ball on off, Amla plays back to it, Kula follows the lifter with a slower ball, dabbed to point with soft hands
Amla can't find the gaps. Back of a length and outside off, he punches sweetly but finds extra cover
back of a length on off, de Kock presses forward and tips it to point
just short of a good length and outside off, de Kock flashes away from the body and a thick outside edge flies to the left of first slip
similar length, angled in on off, de Kock opts to tip it in front of point and hustles across for one. Good response from Amla
beats the outside edge lavishly. Good length, angled in, and straightens away past the waft. Excellent ball from Kula
short of a length and outside off, punched down towards third man, who is rather square
low full-toss, angled in on off, clipped away to deep square leg
waist-high short ball outside off, swatted away with a flat bat to the left of mid-on
whipped from outside off to deep midwicket
full and angled in on off, squirts an inside edge through square leg
high short ball outside off, pulled to deep square leg
steps across off and clips away to deep square leg
short, pulled to the left of deep midwicket
pushed through on leg stump channel, kept out with soft hands
drags the length back and de Kock makes room for himself before cutting but cannot beat backward point
comes down the track looking to go big over the off side but ends up dragging it to the midwicket region off the inside part of the bat
pitched up on leg stump, clipped away off the toes to the midwicket region
on a length and on middle stump, nudges it between midwicket and mid-on
eases it to mid-off
walks across the stumps early before pushing this fuller ball down the pitch, straight back to the bowler
low full toss on the stumps and Amla picks it up and lofts it through the mid-on region as the ball travels flat and a couple of bounces over the boundary
fullish outside off, waits in the crease before opening the face of his bat and steering it to the third man region
shuffles across to protect off-stump before pushing this into covers where it is fielded

pushes it to mid-off and takes off for a non-existent single. The fielder runs across and dives to his left before taking aim at the non-striker's end. Direct throw and he would have been out by a mile
nudges with soft hands to mid-on and again has to scamper across for the single, but this time they make it a tad more comfortably. Still mighty close
pitched up on the stumps, clipped off the toes to deep midwicket
short of a length and spinning away outside off, pushes at it without feet and skews it off the outside edge wide of backward point who runs across and fields it
whips it away from outside off to midwicket and they jog the single this time
comes down the track and looks to go inside-out but checks the shot late as he changes his mind and instead creams it down to long-off
tucked off the pads to midwicket for an easy single. Singles will do it for South Africa. Sri Lanka need to pick wickets
possibly a googly, slides into the pads, flicked square on the leg side
skids on outside off, left alone
shorter and outside off, punched through cover-point
fired short and outside off, the left-hander steps back and forces to sweeper cover
tossed-up legbreak, hint of drift, poked towards point
floated up and outside off, Qdk does not need second invitations for the drive. Opens the face and caresses the ball to the right of extra cover and to the left of point
full again, spins in, poked back to the bowler off an inside edge
full and drifts away outside off, tapped to cover
slides across off, short, punched on the back foot to cover
picked off the pads through square leg
dropped slightly short and outside off, de Kock picks the length up very early. Skips back and cuts firmly to the right of sweeper
back of a length and rolls on off, punchily blocked back to the bowler
Vandersay gives it more air outside off. Length ball, Amla lines it up and slugs it across the line over mid-on
slider outside off, Amla shoulders arms
dropped short and outside off, rocks back and crunches it through the covers on the back foot
full-toss on off, which is punched away to the right of a diving mid-on
Vandersay gives this loads of air on off, played back to the bowler

Sandakan breaks the flourishing opening stand in his second over. Tossed up - very full and wide outside off - turns away from de Kock. He drives loosely in the air, does not meet the pitch, and ends up chipping a catch to debutant Weerakkody, who can also keep wicket, at cover
pitches on leg and turns away, kept out
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
whoa. Pitches around middle and leg and rips away outside off past the outside edge
slow and short outside off, Faf attempts a forcing stroke and chops it past the stumps
leg-side wide
full and outside off, steered into the covers for one
looped up on off, pushed past the bowler's left to long-off
clipped off the pads to deep square leg
back of a length legbreak outside off, punched on the back foot to sweeper
skiddy delivery, Amla plays back and keeps it out
tossed on off, defended with a straight bat to cover on the front foot
lobs this legbreak up outside off, Amla, aiming a drive, does not meet the pitch and slices an outside edge past short third man's left
tossed on middle, driven down to long-on
poked to cover
full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on

pitches on leg or just outside leg, rips away, opens Faf up and hits the back pad in line with off stump. The ball then lobs to slip. No bat involved. Sandakan and Upul chat, chat.... and the umpire Jele gestures the 15-second period has elapsed. SL can't review the on-field not-out decision. Is that a missed opportunity for the visitors?
full on the stumps, played back to thye bowler
punched off the backfoot from outside off down to long-on
that's the one that spins back in, googly at short of good length, du Plessis comes forward but it bounces too much and he cannot make contact
keeps low outside off as du Plessis looks to slap after making room but manages to make contact
googly again, strikes him on the pad but the impact is outside off
nudged to midwicket
gets down to paddle sweep early and plays the line well as the ball goes to the fine leg boundary and beats the fielder there comfortably though he puts in the dive
full toss outside off, driven to cover

penalty runs. Sprayed down the leg side, Amla misses the flick and the ball escapes from between the keeper's legs and hits the helmet behind him and bounces off. They get five runs. Seemed like a wide too initially but not given. Did that perhaps just brush the pad?
opens the face of his bat to work it in front of point and they take off for a quick single
comes forward and defends
fuller ball outside off, pitched right up and there is nice width offered up outside off, du Plessis crashes it through extra cover as he gets it over the fielder with outstretched hands

has Amla been stumped here? Not much excitement from the Sri Lanka fielders. Amla was drawn forward and went for an extravagant drive and ends up being opened up as he loses balance. The wicketkeeper whips the bails off but Amla has dragged his foot back in time
full and drifts into the pads, picked off to deep square leg
overpitched and outside off, gets forward and drills it between covers and mid-off
dragged down on leg stump, helped on the back foot to long leg
dragged down outside off, flat-batted away to wide long-off
full on off, opens the face, running the ball towards point
just short of a good length and outside off, angled towards point
Amla walks across the stumps, this is shorter and outside off, Amla chops it to cover and raises his bat. 31st ODI fifty for Amla. Has been a fluent innings
very full on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
very full and outside off, keeps low, seams in, and beats the inside edge as Faf drives and misses
very full - almost a full-toss down leg - another wide
uses his feet, drives to mid-on, and takes off for a single
flat length ball on the stumps, defended off the front foot down the pitch

some width on offer outside off, shapes away to cut and it spins back in sharply, stabs it in front of point and takes off for a quick single. Throw fired at the keeper's end and Amla has to rush back
pitched up on the stumps, eased down to long-on
waits for it at the crease before steering it wide of backward point
pitched up on off, comes forward and eases into a drive to mid-off
fuller and on the leg stump channel, turned away off the toes to short fine leg
full toss on the stumps, turned away to midwicket where the fielder dives to stop it
short ball, thinks of the hook initially but decides against it and keeps his bat down. The umpire thinks the bounce is alright on that one
short of a length and tailing away late and du Plessis slaps it away to sweeper cover
yorker on the stumps, dug out back to the bowler
short of a length and some width on offer outside off, Amla drops his wrists late and steers it to square third man with an open bat face
fuller ball, driven out to sweeper cover
flighted on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
short and wide, tries to cut and misses
flatter short of a length ball, keeps low but du Plessis is able to stab it to sweeper cover after backing away
flat and back of a length outside off, Amla waits in the crease and whips it with an open bat face to sweeper cover
appeal for lbw as he looked to play through the leg side off the backfoot but gets rapped on the pads as it skids on quickly off the surface and keeps a bit low as well. Inside edge saves him
short ball, rolls his wrists to control the pull shot to deep midwicket
beautiful straight drive. Not much wrong with the delivery. It was very full and bang on the stumps but du Plessis is able to jam the bat down and drills it hard down the ground
short ball, pulled along to deep square leg to bring up the fifty of the partnership.
short and wide outside off, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover who runs to his right and picks it up
stays in the crease and opens the face of his bat to guide it to point

too full, too wide, holding its line around a set of stumps outside off and du Plessis crunches a square drive, gets the placement right as he pummels it well wide of the sweeper cover fielder, leaving him with no chance of getting there
flat length ball, spinning back in, stays leg side of it and knocks it to mid-off
fullish and on the middle and leg stump line, tries to clip it away but closes the face of his bat early and knocks it back to the bowler
tucked behind square
flighted and pushed across outside off, not much turn, du Plessis leans forward and drives it to backward point
tossed up outside off, slower through the air and du Plessis is drawn forward and looks to drive square but the ball spins back in late and beats the edge
tucked to deep square leg and they come charging back for the second run
tries to open his bat face and run it square of the wicket through the off side but is beaten as it keeps low
knocks it off the backfoot to wide long-off
comes back in from the good length region at 88 kph and it is punched down the ground for a single
not much pace, just 89.7kph and on a length, blocked

what a soft dismissal! The lack of pace does him in. This one in fact turns back in like an off-break. Besides, the lack of pace means that he plays early and does not time it well at all. Pops the simplest of return catches and the bowler takes it in front of him. Amla's fluent innings comes to an end but South Africa are coasting here
whipped off the backfoot to the mid-on region where there is a fielder and there will be no run
stays on the backfoot and this one keeps low but he manages to drag it to deep midwicket with a flat bat
pitched up outside off, drills it to long-on
short ball, tries to pull it and ends up flat-batting it to long-on
pushed back to the bowler
makes room and punches this into the vacant spaces in covers for a quick single
fullish outside off, comes forward and pushes it into covers
full and outside off, driven down to long-on for one
full roller on middle, pushed back to Asela
full on off, worked with the wrists to the right of midwicket
full and outside off, opens the face and steers to point
back of a length cutter, 87ks, de Villiers waits for the ball to arrive, then deflects it to square leg
floated outside off, back of a length, punched down to long-off
low full-toss outside off, squeezed down to long-off
full and slides outside off, pushed to mid-off
De Villers goes across off and sweeps, rolling his wrists, to long-on
skidding into the hips, helped to long leg
lobbed up outside off, Faf plays an expansive drive to wide long-off
rank long hop on off, AB skips back and duly dispatches this tripe ball over the wide long-on boundary. SA just 32 away from going 1-0 up
paddled from outside off to long leg
pushed through on off, played back to Asela
floated outside off, Faf shovels this full ball to long-on
full and on off, defended
full on off, AB attempts a reverse-paddle, but the ball grazes the glove and sneaks away to short third man
full on middle, attempts a reverse-paddle again, finds short third man again
floated up outside off, driven off the front foot to sweeper cover

takes a stride across and gets down on one knee to sweep this flighted ball and pierces the gap as he gets it well to the right of the deep midwicket fielder and the ball goes away to the deep square leg boundary
overcompensates by dragging the length back and de Villiers cut off the backfoot to covers. The fielder does not gather it cleanly but they don't risk the second

comes forward and bends forward before clipping this just wide of the fielder at deep square leg and they hare back for the second by the time he can run in, swoop down, collect the ball and release it
driven firmly off the front foot to covers, this time straight to the fielder there
short of a length and spins back in, du Plessis keeps it out
this one comes on straight outside off, no turn and du Plessis presses forward and skews it off the inside part of the blade
flatter fullish length ball, tries to defend and gets an inside-edge to the pads
gets down early to scoop it and the ball goes on the bounce to the fielder at short fine leg
waits for it at the crease and turns it away to midwicket for an easy single
short of a length ball, comes on flat and turns in and de Villiers uses the angle to tuck it to the leg side for a single and to retain strike
flat and pushed through on leg stump, tries to clip it away to the leg side but cannot make good connection
this time it's not as full and on the pads, so he just tucks off them behind square on the leg side
stays back to this length ball and flicks it away to midwicket. Brings the bat down late and so the bowler is excited and just goes up for just a moment
straying down the leg side, du Plessis nudges it fine and the ball seems to be heading down to the deep fine leg boundary, but deep backward square leg runs across and cuts it off in the nick of time
flat and quicker, shorter in length and width on offer outside off as well, backs away and cuts but cannot find the gap
superb inside-out drive through covers. It is nicely flighted and he comes down the track and opens the bat face a bit more to pick the gap as the ball goes through the extra cover region
eases it down towards long-on off the front foot
clipped off the toes into the leg side
nudged behind square
reverse sweep, beats the fielder at short third man who runs to his left and puts in a dive but he gets it very fine and the ball comfortably beats him
defended back to the bowler
slower through the air, tries to get down and do a reverse slap but does not put bat to ball
nudged off the pads towards long leg for a couple. Faf reaches his fifty
tossed up legbreak outside off, sliced away fine of short third man
